main event: A bright light moved erratically in the sky over Grafton, North Dakota and then accelerated and disappeared.
interesting points: The object was described as disc-shaped and 12-15 inches in diameter when viewed at arm's length.
The object had a red glow, compared to the sun when viewed through smoke.
The object was observed while the witness was driving, first at 75 degrees elevation and 60 degrees azimuth, then descending to 0 degrees elevation and 90 degrees azimuth.
The sighting lasted from 0345 to 0425 CST.
No known air traffic or weather balloons were reported in the area at the time.
sighted object: disc-shaped object with a red glow
